ProfessionalSummary:
Digital advertising specialist with over six-years-experience in the development, launching and reportng of
digital ad campaigns, with product implementation, digital analysis skills and great problem-solving abilities.
With professional experience spanning agency, publisher and vendor sides of the advertising industry, I am
looking for new opportunities to work with like-minded individuals to solve real business problems for clients.

EducationDetails.Text: Post-Graduate Certificate, Strategic Relationship Marketing | George Brown College, Toronto, ON | 2014

Bachelor of Business Administration,  Marketing | Memorial University, St. John's, NL | 2013

Accomplishments and Certifications

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~   is experienced in the management of:  Sales; and Business Operations and General Business (Management Activities or Functions).    ~~~~~~   has 5 years of work experience, with 2 years of management experience, including a high-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 8/1/2018, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 10 months:
	Title: Account Manager / Ad Ops Specialist for CBC
Starting on 7/1/2017, the candidate held the following executive-level management position for 13 months:
	Title: Ad Operations Executive for MiQ
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Account Manager / Ad Ops Specialist for CBC), but was not in management in the most recent role as Ad Operations Specialist for Leafly.

Positions.Description:
Managed all ad operations activities for Leafly Canada and assist with the overall development of Ad
Operations processes for North America, including but not limited to sales support, inventory
management, campaign management, campaign reporting and data analysis
● Collaborated with cross-functional teams, i.e. Engineering, Sales, Program Managers and Editorial, to ensure the successful launch of all brand partnership executions, and collaborating with Program
Managers and finance to ensure ad revenue is maximized month over month
● Executed the launch and development of new ad products, including launching a programmatic audience
extension for our clients through partners at StackAdapt to increase traffic to    ~~~~   and client websites
● Trained new members of the North American Ad Ops team on ad-server workflow, forecasting inventory
for direct sold campaigns, how to inspect web pages for targeting capabilities, nuances of cannabis
advertising laws in Canada and the general landscape of advertising opportunities available at Leafly
● Provided monthly and weekly campaign reporting for all Canadian clients, including the development of insights for client check-ins and campaign wrap reports

● Maintained and strengthened ongoing relationships with agency, client direct and non-profit clients
● Successful booking, delivery, optimization, campaign reporting and monthly revenue reconciliation of all
digital ad campaigns, managing yearly budgets of over $2MM and an average of 40 campaigns per month
● Worked with the Sales and Marketing departments to ensure brand-integration sponsorships and
activations on CBC and Radio Canada were set up for success from the booking stage straight through to reporting; Collaborate with Sales and Data Solutions teams to find relevant solutions to KPI requests
● QA the English services team's campaign set up for large scale Share of Voice campaigns, ie. Homepage
Takeovers, CBC Olympic Sport sponsorships, etc, ensuring proper targeting attributes were included
● Assisted with the training of new team members and other internal departments as needed to ensure all
employees follow the same standard of execution across digital campaigns


1

QA, test, traffic and troubleshoot HTML5, Javascript, VAST, VPAID, Mobile and Rich Media ads across
various ad servers and DSP's for programmatic campaigns
● Completed 40% of all tasks that were submitted to the four person North American Ad Ops team in Q1
and Q2 of 2018, including trafficking hosted and third-party display and video creative, screenshots on
multiple devices, and tracking pixel application for various 3rd party providers such as DoubleVerify, IAS,
and MOAT
● Successfully trafficked a $2M campaign for a client based out of NYC, including manually applying tracking
pixels to over 200 pieces of creatives
● Assisted with the development of creative copy for the CiQ website (MiQ's creative portfolio) and provided native ad copy headlines and creative mockups as needed for Canadian clients

Managed AOL's Owned and Operated properties digital ad inventory: AOL, Huffington Post, TechCrunch,
Engadget, MSN, Outlook, Skype, Windows Ads-in-Apps, and Xbox, including training account managers on
new booking and reservation technology and changes to ad products
● Forecasted inventory availability and collaborated with yield management to determine product pricing
and identify revenue opportunities and first-to-market opportunities for clients
● Worked with sales executives and account managers to ensure media plans were accurate, identified
inventory challenges and proactively alerted key stakeholders of potential delivery issues
● Creative manager for in-house builds, providing creative recommendations to internal and external
stakeholders, investigating and escalating technical and user experience issues to developers, ensuring
creatives met client approval and were launched successfully

● Promoted from Digital Traffic Coordinator to Ad Operations Specialist in July 2015
● Managed the day-to-day trafficking for several large automotive, CPG and financial accounts acting as the primary trafficker for Ford Canada and Lincoln Canada; Worked closely with sales planners, creative
agencies and publishers to provide ongoing support for third-party tag and pixel implementation
● Trained junior members on digital trafficking best practices and nuances across ad servers
● Generated and distributed third-party assets to vendors and publishers and to provide ongoing account
maintenance during the campaign lifecycle
● Worked closely with post-production teams to QA assets, ensure functionality across browsers and mobile
devices, and that creatives adhered to IAB specifications and troubleshoot technical issues as needed

LanguageCompetencies.FoundInContext: ● QA the English services team's campaign set

Achievements: Google Online Marketing Challenge, 2nd Place Award (Global) | 2012

Trainings.Text: Google Online Marketing Challenge, 2nd Place Award (Global) | 2012

QualificationsSummary:
Skill Highlights

● Strong knowledge of the ad operations ecosystem and user behaviour across publisher platforms
● Highly experienced with ad servers, DSP's and DMP's including: AppNexus, Google, Lotame, Sizmek,
StackAdapt, and TripleLift, as well as web site analysis tools ie. Google Analytics
● Excellent Google Suite and Microsoft Office skills with a strong aptitude to learn new technologies
● Knowledgeable in HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS and experienced with debugging and web inspection tools
● Experienced using project management and ticketing systems including Trello, Salesforce and JIRA

Findings.Message: You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'Skill Highlights'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
